Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2011 09:49AM panamajayne wrote:  yesterday told my MO about the Vit B12 shot and he was more concerned about the risk of infection.  I'm going to still get them at least 1-2x's a week as I was amazed how quickly I returned to having energy and feeling like doing things.  My friend who gives me the shots was a nurse in Texas before retiring to Panama.  Another friend - male- had radiation for his cancer and he got the shots too which made him have more energy too.
Posts.Title: Vitamin B12 shots panamajayne panamajayne

Posts.Content: panamajayne wrote: anyone getting these shots while in chemo? If so how often?   I had my first B12 today mainly because I have been so exhausted that I actually was thinking of quitting chemo.  In 2 days I will have the 3rd once a month  of 4 Taxols, have already had the 4 A+C, then after Taxol will have Herceptin once a month for 12 times.  I hope my MO  will tell me it is ok to have a B12 shot every other day  I don't just believe in miracles, I depend on them Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Vitamin B12 shots panamajayne panamajayne

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2011 10:28PM panamajayne wrote: mammalou, many years ago a  dermatologist told me that shaving our faces was the best form of exfoliating,  So I did it, felt odd doing it the first time, but my face skin is so much smoother as it gets rid of the dead cells.  Does not grow back like male stubble and I shave my face about 2-3 times week for the exfoliation.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2011 09:06PM panamajayne wrote: I have always had a lot of fine straight hair.  A little strand shedding and thinning during the 4 rounds of A+C.  Had 2nd  of 4 Taxol treatments 2 weeks ago.  Yesterday my hair began heavy shedding but even worse my scalp hurts to  the point I put my head under cold water and am taking pain meds.  Anyone know if the scalp pain is typical?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2011 09:26AM - edited Aug 11, 2011 09:27AM by panamajayne bikenyc,  thanks for your reply, 3 days ago someone I had not seen for several weeks thought I had on  wig as my hair still looked the same as before the koolaid cocktails. Now hair is thinning out so much that I'm going to wear a hat, wig or whatever.  I also have had 2 haircuts since beginning chemo, more for the styling as hair was still growing.  Wondering if my luck has run out.

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2011 12:13PM panamajayne wrote: I'm very lucky so far as I still have my head hair, eyelashes and eyebrows even though I have finished  4 A+C once every 21 day treatments and 1 once a month Taxol with 3 more Taxol to go before Herceptin.   Have shed strands of hair & my blonde hair has turned a whiteish color.  Still have to shave my legs but no armpit hair.  All my hair is still growing which keeps me a happy girl on this unwanted journey.
